Since the buyer knows the odds of a high-quality product are 33.33%, they have a positive expected value from the purchase:

* Expected Value = (Probability of High-Quality * Value of High-Quality) + (Probability of Low-Quality * Value of Low-Quality) 
* Expected Value = (0.3333 * $200) + (0.6667 * $0) = $66.66 

This means, on average, the buyer is expected to make a profit of $66.66 per purchase.  Therefore, it's a good decision to recommend buying.
